There is a breadth of information available online for the criteria outlined in this tool. Links to relevant materials are provided in the 'What does this mean?' section for each criteria, but the following resources are particularly good:

* [Duck Book](https://best-practice-and-impact.github.io/qa-of-code-guidance/intro.html)

* [R for Data Science book](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/)

* [Scottish Government list of RAP resources](https://scotsconnect.sharepoint.com/sites/StatisticsGroup-Org-SG/SitePages/Reproducible-Analytical-Pipelines-Resources.aspx)

The Data Innovation team can provide [support to analytical teams in the Scottish Government who want to develop a RAP](https://scotsconnect.sharepoint.com/sites/StatisticsGroup-Org-SG/SitePages/Support-for-Reproducible-Analytical-Pipelines.aspx).

In addition, there are Scottish Government Viva Engage communities for both [RAP](https://engage.cloud.microsoft/main/groups/eyJfdHlwZSI6Ikdyb3VwIiwiaWQiOiIxOTI2NDMyMzU4NSJ9) and [R](https://engage.cloud.microsoft/main/groups/eyJfdHlwZSI6Ikdyb3VwIiwiaWQiOiI2MzQ4MzE2NjczIn0) where you can ask questions and share knowledge.
